column1: Report doesn't do Date Validation if one of the date is before 1970
column26:
When creating a report, you can manually type in the date but if one of the date is before 1970/01/01, the error won’t be visible.

!image-20240425-133406.png|width=603,height=473,alt="image-20240425-133406.png"!



!image-20240425-133606.png|width=603,height=473,alt="image-20240425-133606.png"!

column1: Reports - New Report modal closes without confirm prompt
column26:
When creating a new report using the new React “New Report” modal, clicking outside of the modal closes it without a prompt to the user. This is inconsistent with other modals in the platform (ex: Alerts Modal confirms if the user wants to leave).

*Steps to Reproduce:*

* Go to reports in new  React Views
* Click New Report
* Fill in any amount of information
* Click outside of the modal
** OR click the cancel / X buttons

*Actual Behavior:* 

* Modal Closes without prompt
* Entered data is removed/cleared

*Expected Behavior*

* Confirmation dialog should pop up prompting user if they want to cancel and all data will be cleared

column1: Reports - Global Search breaks on search for '1%'

See details in linked ticket or attached video.

column277: 2024-03-28 2:24 PM;5f7b2de5021acf0076da73cf;I think I have a solution for this one. I’ll verify it over the weekend when it won’t affect anyone.
column278:
2024-04-01 8:54 AM;5f7b2de5021acf0076da73cf;After an unsuccessful attempt at fixing this on the weekend, Ryan and I discussed it and it’s going in as tech debt.
From a customer’s point of view, they can see the case they are in or switch cases while viewing a report, but there appear to be no other associated bugs.
The workaround is clicking on anything, which loads another part of the platform, that does show the case switcher in the bar bar.

column1: Reports - List Page - Readonly user shown "No Reports added yet, let's create one" message when no reports are present
column26:
The message “No Reports added yet, let's create one!“ is shown for readonly users when no reports are present, but readonly users do not have permissions to create reports. 

See attached screenshot.

!image-20240326-165609.png|width=2880,height=1580!

column276:
2024-03-26 3:23 PM;5f7b2de5021acf0076da73cf;If a user doesn’t have access to edit a thing, the message should say ‘No Reports added yet.’.
If the user can create a report, the message should stay the same.
column277:
2024-03-27 8:25 AM;5f899c4106d16d006fb780c0;Make sure this covers:

* Readonly users
* Case readonly users
* Team readonly users

column1: Reports - List - Historic queries and Fusion queries are shown with a type of "Query"
column26:
Reports created with Historic queries and fusion queries as their source are shown as “Query“ in the Type column:

!image-20240326-152124.png|width=960,height=528!

They are also shown as Queries in the info popup, *but this matches the behaviour of the old UI.*

!image-20240326-153950.png|width=922,height=309!



This differs from the old UI as different icons were shown for fusion and historic queries:

!image-20240326-154000.png|width=1414,height=665!

column1: Reports - View - Clicking on a value in the Sentiment graph doesn't do anything
column26:
In the old UI, when the user clicked on a value in the sentiment graph, the user was taken to the query or following. In the new UI this doesn’t happen, clicking on a value doesn’t do anything. 

See attached screen capture.

!2024-03-26_11-19-15.mp4|width=1920,height=1080!
